summary: We testified on the Coast Guard's primary challenge as it invests billions of dollars in its highest priority programs—developing stable ship designs. The design of the Polar Security Cutter, a heavy icebreaker, is more complex and taking over 3 years longer than expected—delaying delivery of the lead ship by about 5 years. And the program's costs increased by more than $2 billion due to these...
title: Coast Guard Acquisitions: Opportunities Exist to Improve Shipbuilding Outcomes
